description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21416) affecting Windows TCP/IP:

1. Download the relevant KB updates corresponding to your Windows build from the official Microsoft Update Catalog.
2. Follow the on-screen instructions to install the updates.
3. Restart your computer to ensure the updates take effect.

**Details**:
- This fix addresses a heap-based buffer overflow that could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.
- Ensure that your system is running one of the affected Windows versions:
  - Windows 10 Version 21H2: 10.0.19044.4894
  - Windows 10 Version 22H2: 10.0.19045.4894
  - Windows 11 Version 21H2: 10.0.22000.3197
  - Windows 11 Version 22H2: 10.0.22621.4169
  - Windows 11 Version 23H2: 10.0.22631.4169
  - Windows 11 Version 24H2: 10.0.26100.1742

For manual installation, you can download the updates from the following links:
- [KB5043067](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043067)
- [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
- [KB5043080](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043080)
- [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)

**Preconditions**:
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
- Administrative privileges are required to apply the updates.
